intro: Alaternus pumilus, commonly known as the dwarf alaternus, is a small, herbaceous plant native to specific regions of Europe. It belongs to the family Apiaceae, which includes many aromatic herbs and vegetables. The plant typically grows to a height of less than 30 centimeters, with slender stems and small, clustered leaves. Its flowers are usually white or pale yellow, appearing in umbels, and it blooms during the summer months. Alaternus pumilus is often found in moist, shaded environments such as woodlands and along stream banks.
